title: South Africa: Measles, rubella and diphtheria updates
Ethiopia to commercially cultivate GMO maize
desc: A genetically modified (GM) variety of maize is set to be commercially grown in Ethiopia for the first time this year. The government has approved a 10-year permit for the crop, starting with a trial batch of about 80 kilograms of seed supplied by Bayer, the German chemical giant. The move follows field trials conducted between 2023 and 2024 in Wondogenet, Melkassa, and Bako, which, according to the Ethiopian Environmental Protection Authority, showed the GM maize outperformed traditional varieties. The decision represents a major policy shift in Ethiopia’s agricultural sector, even amid ongoing concerns about the potential health and environmental…
